TunableEnum.name: active_career_type
TunableEnum.description: Whether this career is an active career type. Active careers appear in a separate tab in the Join Career dialog, and multi-sim active careers will have behavior that allows multiple sims to travel to the same career. Active careers expect career_events to be non-empty at runtime. If all events are culled (e.g., all events come from an unavailable pack), then the career is considered non-active. If career events are started outside the career system leaving career_events empty, then the career type should indicate that via the DYNAMIC_EVENTS type.

Tunable.name: allow_active_offlot
Tunable.description: If checked, will allow travelling to active career even if sim is off lot.

TunableList.name: aspirations_to_activate
TunableList.description: A list of aspirations we want to activate while the Sim is in this career. This saves from having to track them when the Sim is not in the career. Note: You don't need to tune Aspirations that the Career Level references directly. But if those aspirations rely on others, then they need to be tuned here.

Tunable.description: A Career Aspiration that we want to activate when the Sim is in this career.

Tunable.name: available_for_club_criteria
Tunable.description: If enabled, this career type will be available for selection when creating Club Criteria. If disabled, it will not be available.

TdescFragTag.name: block_promotion_tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that if passed will block career promotions. Resolver is a SingleSimResolver specific to the sim in the career. Promotions are evaluated EOD, if a sim should be promoted but is blocked, then they will be promoted on next EOD after they are no longer blocked.

TunableVariant.name: build_buy_info
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning data that will be used in the Gig Info panel in build buy. Currently, this is only used for the Decorator Gig when the player is on the client's lot.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A collection of data used for the Gig Info panel in Build Buy.

Tunable.name: budget_label
Tunable.description: The budget label in the panel. Right now, this will always be the label above the client's budget.

Tunable.name: help_text
Tunable.description: This is the text shown when the player hovers over the question mark icon in the header.

Tunable.name: over_budget_label
Tunable.description: The budget label in the panel if the player goes over budget.

Tunable.name: payout_label
Tunable.description: The payout label in the panel. Right now, this will always be the label above the payout for the current Decorator Gig.

Tunable.name: wallet_tooltip_budget_label
Tunable.description: The budget label in the Simoleon Wallet tooltip.

Tunable.name: wallet_tooltip_over_budget_label
Tunable.description: The budget label in the Simoleon Wallet Tooltip if the player goes over budget.

TunableVariant.name: call_costar_interaction
TunableVariant.description: The interaction to push a sim to call up their costars. This is added for gigs.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction to push a sim to call up their costars. This is added for gigs.

Tunable.name: can_be_fired
Tunable.description: Whether or not the Sim can be fired from this career. For example, children cannot be fired from school.

TunableVariant.description: The interaction to push on a sim who cancels an audition.

TunableVariant.description: The interaction to push on a sim to cancel a gig.

Tunable.name: career_affordance
Tunable.description: SI to push to go to work.

TdescFragTag.name: career_availablity_tests
TdescFragTag.description: When a Sim calls to join a Career, this test set determines if a particular career can be available to that Sim at all. This test set determines if a Career is visible in the Career Panel.

TunableEnum.name: career_category
TunableEnum.description: Category for career, this will be used for aspirations and other systems which should trigger for careers categories but not for others.

TunableVariant.name: career_display_name_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will override the Career name in the Career Panel in the UI. This should be used for Careers that allow multiple active gigs, as each gig will be appear as its own 'career' in the Career Panel. This will use a number token. Ex: Quest #{0.Number}

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The text we want to use to override the title bar in for this career in the Career Panel.

TunableEnum.name: career_event_decline_option
TunableEnum.description: Select what will happen if the player chooses to decline the career event confirmation dialog.

TunableList.name: career_events
TunableList.description: A list of available career events.

TunableVariant.name: career_location
TunableVariant.description: Define where Sims go to work.

TunableTuple.name: company
TunableTuple.description: Sims go to work in rabbit holes or active career venues. They are assigned a random company name to define 'where' they work.

TunableList.name: company_names
TunableList.description: A list of random company names. A Sim's career is assigned one of these and the selection is preserved.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: service_npc
TunableTuple.description: A career location for service NPCs that allows them to work on other sims' home lots.

TunableList.name: company_names
TunableList.description: A list of random company names. A Sim's career is assigned one of these and the selection is preserved.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: venue
TunableTuple.description: Sims go to work at a specific venue. If the lot no longer matches the required venue type, the Sim is fired from the career.

TunableList.name: venues
TunableList.description: The set of required venue types to be in this career.

Tunable.description: The required venue for this career.

If this is <= 0, the notification will not be shown." tuning_state="NeedsTuning" group="General" />

TunableEnum.name: career_panel_type
TunableEnum.description: Type of panel that UI should use for this career.

Tunable.name: career_rabbit_hole
Tunable.description: Rabbit hole to put sim in when they are at work.

TdescFragTag.name: career_selectable_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Test set that determines if a career that is available to a Sim is valid or not. This test set determines if a Career is selectable in the Career Panel.

TunableVariant.name: quitting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, Sims will be able to quit this career via Story Progression. This does not override the 'can_quit' flag on the career tuning.

TunableTuple.description: The weight of a particular Sim quitting this career versus all other eligible Sims doing the same. A weight of zero prevents the Sim from quitting the career.

Tunable.name: base_value

TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: retiring
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, Sims will be able to retire from this career via Story Progression. This does not override the 'can_quit' flag on the career tuning. Story Progression will attempt to have Sims retire before having Sims quit.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The weight of a particular Sim retiring from this career versus all other eligible Sims doing the same. A weight of zero prevents the Sim from retiring from the career.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers

Tunable.name: current_gig_limit
Tunable.description: The maximum number of concurrent, active gigs that this career allows for each Sim.

Tunable.name: days_to_level_loss
Tunable.description: When you leave a career, we store off the level you would rejoin the career at. Every days_to_level_loss days you will lose another level. i.e. I quit my job at level 8. I get reduced 'level 7 right away because of levels_lost_on_leave. Then with days_to_level_loss set to 3, in 3 days I would goto level 6, in 6 days level 5, etc...

TunableVariant.name: demotion_buff

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableTuple.name: demotion_chance_modifiers
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of test sets and associated multipliers to apply to the moment of a Sim's demotion, to provide the chance that Sim will get demoted. A resultant modifier value of 0.50 means at the point of work end where performance would require demotion, the Sim would have a 50% chance of being demoted. Any resultant value over 1 will result in demotion.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: disable_pto
Tunable.description: If checked, will disable PTO references in the UI. This option is incompatible with setting any pto tuning in the carrer or career levels to non-default values.

Tunable.name: display_career_info
Tunable.description: If checked, the full set of career messages are displayed for this career. This includes notifications when the career is joined as well as performance evaluation results. If unchecked, those two sets of data are not made visible to the player, e.g. for school career.

TunableTuple.name: early_promotion_chance
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of test sets and associated multipliers to apply to the percentage chance, should the early promotion modifier deem that early promotion is possible, that a Sim is in fact given a promotion. A resolved value of 0.10 will result in a 10% chance.

If you aren't sure if your tuning is correct, please try it out in game to verify that it behaves correctly.

Tunable.name: start_track

Career tracks can branch at the end of a track, to multiple different tracks which is tuned within the career track tuning.

TunableList.name: tested_affordances
TunableList.description: A list of test sets to run to choose the affordance to go work. If an affordance is found from this list, it will be pushed onto the Sim. If no affordance is found from this list that pass the tests, normal work affordance behavior will take over, running 'career_affordance' if at home or 'go_home_to_work_affordance' if not at home.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The career affordance for this test set.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that if passed will make this the affordance that is run to send the Sim to work.

TunableVariant.name: whim_set
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this career will offer a whim set to any sim that is in this career.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A whim set that is active when this career is active.
